data.description: Job Title: Summer 2026 Intern - Agentic AI for CMC DigitalizationLocation: Framingham, MAAbout the JobAre you ready to shape the future of medicine? The race is on to speed up drug discovery and development to find answers for patients and their families. Your skills could be critical in helping our teams accelerate progress.We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. We’re also a company where you can flourish and grow your career, with countless opportunities to explore, make connections with people, and stretch the limits of what you thought was possible. Ready to get started?The proposed position is based in R&D, CMC (Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls) Development supporting activities in the Data Science group. Sanofi is committed to becoming the first biopharma to do AI at scale by harnessing the full value of data and responsibly building AI products. A global initiative called “iCMC Digital Transformation” has been digitizing scientific / lab workflows over the last few years. This unique and ambitious program spanning over 2,500+ users and 10+ countries, has already resulted in a lot of data with tremendous potential to turn CMC into an AI-powered organization.This summer intern will directly support this vision by exploring the development of Agentic AI approaches embedded as part of the digitalization of workflows that would help accelerate this digital transformation.Specifically, the role would entail the design, development, and evaluation of AI agents that transform in part or the whole lab workflow digitalization. Some of these agents would be built to deliver capabilities such as, but not limited to:Turning user requirements from process scientists into specific user stories for enhancing electronic lab notebook features or support method development,Developing a parser that turns equipment results file into machine readable results output, andDeveloping automated visualizations from the dataIn addition, the intern might have the opportunity to support AI capabilities of some of the in-house platforms for suitability within Sanofi CMC workflowsAbout YouBasic Qualifications:Currently enrolled and pursuing a master's degree or PhD in Chemical, Biological or Biochemical Engineering, Computer Engineering/Science, or related field with the expectation that you will complete your current degree by the Spring of 2027Coursework or research experience in Artificial Intelligence with focus on Large Language Models and building AI AgentsMust be enrolled in school the semester following your internship/co-op with Sanofi Must be able to relocate to the office location and work 40hrs/week, Monday-Friday, for the full duration of the co-op/internship (work onsite at least 3 days a week)Must cloud-technologies for building AI-solutionsKnowledge of software development lifecycle and general understanding of the deployment of AI/ML solutions (e.g. CI/CD, Orchestration)Ability to create visualizations using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly or Tableau to communicate insights effectivelyGood exposure with core data science languages (with Python, and R), Snowflake and other database systems (such as SQL, NoSQL)Hands on with Data science workflows such as data manipulation, data analysis and machine learning tasksCoursework or research experience in biologics or synthetics process development or biopharmaceutical manufacturingKnowledge of software development lifecycleStrong interest in bringing AI-first mindset in day-to-day scientific workflows Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learnWhy Choose Us?Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.Discover
